Body:
I use ESP32 as client for my socket.io server application. I need ESP32 to send MAC Address as query within connect" method. In my browser I can do:

io('localhost:2000'
column9:
{query: { mac: 222222 }})

I need ESP32 to do the same thing
column10: but I am limited to the WiFiClient library
column11:
which I can use for a basic connection to the server:

client.connect(host
column12:
port)

But I want to send additional information

Body: `WiFiClient` is for TCP connections. There is no such thing as a query parameter. Either use a socket.io library or implement the protocol yourself.

In order to query something, you have to prepare the HTTP request, describing it with the println function. You can see an example below, extracted from the official site:

#include <SPI.h>	#include <WiFi.h>		char ssid[] = "myNetwork";          //  your network SSID (name)	char pass[] = "myPassword";   // your network password		int status = WL_IDLE_STATUS;	IPAddress server(74
column11: 105);  // Google		// Initialize the client library	WiFiClient client;		void setup() {	  Serial.begin(9600);	  Serial.println("Attempting to connect to WPA network...");	  Serial.print("SSID: ");	  Serial.println(ssid);		  status = WiFi.begin(ssid
column12: pass);	  if ( status != WL_CONNECTED) {	    Serial.println("Couldn't get a wifi connection");	    // don't do anything else:	    while(true);	  }	  else {	    Serial.println("Connected to wifi");	    Serial.println("\nStarting connection...");	    // if you get a connection
